title: 111_hr2940
content: The Act titled "Women's Obstetrician and Gynecologist Medical Access Now Act of 2009" ensures women's access to obstetrical and gynecological services through amendments to group health plans under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Act ensures direct access for participants and beneficiaries to obstetrical and gynecological physician services without requiring prior approval from another physician or provider. The Act allows direct access to obstetrical and gynecological physician services without prior approval, with provisions for communication and utilization protocols. Physicians and surgeons in the plan network must follow provisions consistent with the Act, similar to those for other primary care providers, and not more restrictive for obstetrical and gynecological services. Imposing this requirement is considered a material modification under group health plans. The requirement in this section is a material modification in the plan terms, ensuring notice under the plan. Section 732(a) of the Act is amended, and the table of contents is updated accordingly. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include a new section, SEC. 2708, which sets a standard for women's access to obstetrical and gynecological services. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 provisions apply to group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage. Group health plans must comply with notice requirements under the Act. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding group health plans. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 provisions apply to group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding group health plans, including a new standard relating to women's access to obstetrical and gynecological services. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 provisions apply to group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding group health plans, including a new standard relating to women's access to obstetrical and gynecological services under SEC. 2754. The provisions of section 2708(a) apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market as they do in connection with group health plans. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. Effective dates for group health plans and insurance coverage are specified. The amendment made by subsection (b) applies to individual health insurance coverage in the market on or after the enactment date. There is an exception for group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the enactment date. The Secretary of Labor, Treasury, and Health and Human Services will coordinate administration through an interagency memorandum of understanding to ensure regulations are consistent. Plan amendments under collective bargaining agreements to conform to new requirements will not terminate the agreement. The Secretaries will coordinate to ensure consistent administration and enforcement of regulations to avoid duplication of efforts and assign enforcement priorities.
